title: American_Top_40_1987_August_8th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

George Michael is at number two with his song, "I Want Your Sex." For as long as that song was in the countdown, Casey refused to say its title in his broadcast!

Michael Jackson debuts on the hot 100 with his song, "I Just CanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t Stop Loving You," all the way up at number 37.

A listener wants to know, "Which men have had the most top ten solo hits in the rock era?" Casey lists the top three.

There's a singer in the countdown who, with her latest hit, ties Lionel Richie for most consecutive top 10 hits in the 80's. This lady hasn't missed the top 10 since her first hit in 1984, and had 13 as of August, 1987.

One song on the chart was inspired by a fight the songwriter had with his wife. When the wife heard the new song, she wanted equal say, wrote some lyrics and the song became a hit in this countdown.

One singer on the chart originally wanted to be a music teacher. As of 1987 she had over 50 hits, 31 top 40 hits, and five Grammys.

Another singer in this broadcast was asked to play a command performance for the Prince of Wales without ever having a hit song.
